intro: Stachys mexicana, commonly known as Mexican hedge-net, is a perennial herb native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in rocky or open habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
